--- Copyright (c) 2025 amonamona --- CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/ --- LightBoard Prelude --[[ local triggerId = '' local function setTriggerId(tid) triggerId = tid if type(prelude) ~= "nil" then return end local source = getLoreBooks(triggerId, 'lightboard-prelude') if not source or #source == 0 then error('Failed to load lightboard-prelude.') end load(source[1].content, '@prelude', 't')() end ]] ---@param str string ---@return string local function trim(str) -- Remove leading whitespace (%s* at the start ^) str = string.gsub(str, "^%s*", "") -- Remove trailing whitespace (%s* at the end $) str = string.gsub(str, "%s*$", "") return str end ---@param str string ---@return string local function escEntities(str) if not str then return "" end str = str:gsub("&", "&"):gsub("<", "<"):gsub(">", ">"):gsub('"', """):gsub("'", "'"):gsub("\\n", "
") return str end ---@param str string ---@return string local function escMatch(str) str = str:gsub("(%W)", "%%%1") return str end ---@param str string ---@return string local function escQuotes(str) if not str then return "" end local result = {} for character in str:gmatch("([%z\1-\127\194-\244][\128-\191]*)") do if character == '"' or character == "‚Äú" or character == "‚Äù" then table.insert(result, """) elseif character == "'" or character == "‚Äò" or character == "‚Äô" then table.insert(result, "'") else table.insert(result, character) end end return table.concat(result) end ---Extracts contents between all [Tag] ... [Tag]. ---@param tag string ---@param content string ---@return string[] local function extractBlocks(tag, content) local results = {} local openTag = "[" .. tag .. "]" local pos = 1 while true do local s, e = content:find(openTag, pos, true) if not s then break end -- find next occurrence of the same tag local nextS = content:find(openTag, e + 1, true) if nextS then table.insert(results, content:sub(e + 1, nextS - 1)) pos = nextS else -- last segment table.insert(results, content:sub(e + 1)) break end end return results end ---@class Node ---@field attributes table ---@field content string ---@field rangeEnd number ---@field rangeStart number ---Extracts all nodes. ---@param text string ---@return Node[] local function extractNodes(tagNameRaw, text) local results = {} local i = 1 local tagName = tagNameRaw:gsub("(%W)", "%%%1") while true do local startIdx = text:find("<" .. tagName, i) if not startIdx then break end -- Find where the opening tag ends local tagEnd = text:find(">", startIdx) if not tagEnd then i = startIdx + 1 goto continue end -- Extract all attributes from the opening tag local openTagContent = text:sub( startIdx + #("<" .. tagNameRaw), tagEnd - 1 ) local attrs = {} -- quoted attributes: key="val" or key='val' for key, _, val in openTagContent:gmatch("([%w:_-]+)%s*=%s*(['\"])(.-)%2") do attrs[key] = val end -- unquoted attributes: key=val for key, val in openTagContent:gmatch("([%w:_-]+)%s*=%s*([^%s\"'>]+)") do if not attrs[key] then attrs[key] = val end end -- boolean attributes: key (without value) -- First, remove all already parsed attributes to avoid conflicts local tempContent = openTagContent -- Remove quoted attributes tempContent = tempContent:gsub("([%w:_-]+)%s*=%s*(['\"])(.-)%2", "") -- Remove unquoted attributes tempContent = tempContent:gsub("([%w:_-]+)%s*=%s*([^%s\"'>]+)", "") -- Now find standalone attribute names for key in tempContent:gmatch("([%w:_-]+)") do if key and key ~= "" and not attrs[key] then attrs[key] = "true" end end -- Find closing tag local closeStart, _ = text:find("", tagEnd) if not closeStart then i = tagEnd + 1 goto continue end local closeEnd = closeStart + #("") - 1 -- Extract inner content local contentOnly = text:sub(tagEnd + 1, closeStart - 1) table.insert(results, { attributes = attrs, content = contentOnly, rangeEnd = closeEnd, rangeStart = startIdx, }) i = closeEnd + 1 ::continue:: end return results end ---Get a lore book with the highest insert order. ---@param triggerId string ---@param name string ---@return LoreBook? local function getPriorityLoreBook(triggerId, name) local books = getLoreBooks(triggerId, name) if not books or #books == 0 then return nil end table.sort(books, function(a, b) return (a.insertorder or 0) > (b.insertorder or 0) end) return books[1] end ---Heals broken UTF-8 sequences in <0xXX> format. ---@param str string ---@return string local function killGuim(str) local out, buf = {}, {} local function flush() if #buf > 0 then local s = string.char(table.unpack(buf)) if utf8.len(s) then out[#out + 1] = s else for _, b in ipairs(buf) do out[#out + 1] = string.format("<0x%02x>", b) end end buf = {} end end local i = 1 while true do local s, e, hex = str:find("<0x(%x%x)>", i) if not s then break end if s > i then flush() out[#out + 1] = str:sub(i, s - 1) end buf[#buf + 1] = tonumber(hex, 16) i = e + 1 end flush() if i <= #str then out[#out + 1] = str:sub(i) end return table.concat(out) end ---Parses a block into a proper table. ---@param block string ---@param tagToEnd string[]? ---@return table local function parseBlock(block, tagToEnd) local metadata = {} if type(tagToEnd) == "table" then for _, tag in ipairs(tagToEnd) do if tag and tag ~= "" then local currentPattern = "%[" .. tag:gsub("(%W)", "%%%1") .. "%]" local tagStartMatch = block:find(currentPattern) if tagStartMatch then block = block:sub(1, tagStartMatch - 1) break end end end end for part in block:gmatch("([^|]+)") do local field, value = part:match("([^:]+):(.+)") if field and value then field = trim(field) value = trim(value) metadata[field] = value end end return metadata end ---@param str string ---@param sep string ---@return string[] local function split(str, sep) local result = {} if not str then return result end if sep == "" then result[1] = str return result end local start = 1 local idx = 1 while true do local s, e = str:find(sep, start, true) if not s then result[idx] = str:sub(start) break end result[idx] = str:sub(start, s - 1) start = e + #sep idx = idx + 1 end return result end _ENV.prelude = { escEntities = escEntities, escMatch = escMatch, escQuotes = escQuotes, extractBlocks = extractBlocks, extractNodes = extractNodes, getPriorityLoreBook = getPriorityLoreBook, killGuim = killGuim, parseBlock = parseBlock, split = split, trim = trim } local gen_mt, tag_mt, safe_mt local function rawHTML(html) if type(html) == "string" then return setmetatable({ html = html }, safe_mt) else return end end -- get printable HTML, escaping unless marked to be used raw local function safeHTML(text) if getmetatable(text) == safe_mt then return text.html end return escEntities(text) end -- create HTML from a table local function genHTML(tag, content) -- convenience; can call with table or string parameter if type(content) == "string" then return genHTML(tag, { content }) end local name = tag._name:gsub("_", "-") local tagClass = tag._class content.class = content.class and ((tagClass or " ") .. content.class) or tagClass or nil local attTable = {} local bodyTable = {} for k, v in pairs(content) do local t = type(k) if t == "string" and k ~= "closed" and not k ~= "void" then if k == "htmlFor" then k = "for" end attTable[#attTable + 1] = ('%s="%s"'):format(k:gsub("_", "-"), safeHTML(tostring(v))) elseif not content.void and not content.closed and t == "number" then local vt = type(v) if vt == "table" and getmetatable(v) ~= safe_mt then for _, child in ipairs(v) do bodyTable[#bodyTable + 1] = safeHTML(child) end elseif vt ~= "nil" then bodyTable[#bodyTable + 1] = safeHTML(v) end end end local atts = table.concat(attTable, " ") if #atts > 0 then atts = " " .. atts end local body = table.concat(bodyTable) if content.void then return rawHTML(("<%s%s>"):format(name, atts)) end if content.closed then return rawHTML(("<%s%s />"):format(name, atts)) end local html = ("<%s%s>%s"):format(name, atts, body, name) return rawHTML(html) end gen_mt = { __index = function(context, name) local tag = setmetatable({ _name = name, _class = false }, tag_mt) context[name] = tag return tag end } tag_mt = { __call = genHTML, __index = function(tag, class) local tagWithClass = setmetatable({ _name = tag._name, _class = class }, tag_mt) tag[class] = tagWithClass return tagWithClass end } safe_mt = { __tostring = function(self) return self.html end } local function hx() return setmetatable({}, gen_mt) end _ENV.h = hx() _ENV.hraw = rawHTML

"%s*=%s*[\"']" .. prelude.escMatch(v) .. "[\"']" if not attrString:find(attrPattern) then matchAttrs = false break end end end if not matchAttrs then searchPos = e + 1 goto continue end local closePattern = "" local closeStart, closeEnd = text:find(closePattern, e + 1, true) if closeStart then local prefix = text:sub(1, s - 1) local suffix = text:sub(closeEnd + 1) prefix = prefix:gsub("\n+$", "") suffix = suffix:gsub("^\n+", "") return prefix .. '\n' .. suffix else return text end ::continue:: end end --- @param str string --- @param m number --- @return string local function truncateRepeats(str, m) local maxCount = m or 4 local prev, cnt = nil, 0 local out = {} -- iterate over UTF-8 characters for ch in str:gmatch("([%z\1-\127\194-\244][\128-\191]*)") do if ch == prev then cnt = cnt + 1 else prev, cnt = ch, 1 end if cnt <= maxCount then out[#out + 1] = ch end end return table.concat(out) end --- @class Manifest --- @field authorsNote boolean --- @field charDesc boolean --- @field identifier string --- @field lazy boolean --- @field loreBooks boolean --- @field mode '1'|'2' --- @field multilingual boolean --- @field personaDesc boolean --- @field rerollBehavior 'preserve-prev'|'remove-prev' --- @field onInput (fun (triggerId: string, input: string, index: number): string)? --- @field onOutput (fun (triggerId: string, output: string): string)? --- Retrieves active manifests. --- @param globalMode '1'|'2' --- @return Manifest[] local function getManifests(globalMode) local manifests = getLoreBooks(triggerId, "manifest.lb") local parsedManifests = {} for _, manifest in ipairs(manifests) do if manifest.content and manifest.content ~= "" then local tbl = {} -- split into lines for line in manifest.content:gmatch("[^\r\n]+") do local k, v = line:match("^([^=]+)=(.*)$") if k and v then k = k:match("^%s*(.-)%s*$") if not k then goto continueParsing end tbl[k] = v end ::continueParsing:: end local identifier = tbl.identifier if not identifier or identifier == "" then goto continueManifest end if not tbl.authorsNote then tbl.authorsNote = getGlobalVar(triggerId, "toggle_" .. identifier .. ".lazy") == "1" else tbl.lazy = tbl.lazy == "true" end if not tbl.multilingual then tbl.multilingual = true else tbl.multilingual = tbl.multilingual == "true" end if not tbl.personaDesc then tbl.personaDesc = getGlobalVar(triggerId, "toggle_" .. identifier .. ".personaDesc") == "1" else tbl.personaDesc = tbl.personaDesc == "true" end if not tbl.rerollBehavior then tbl.rerollBehavior = "preserve-prev" end local function getCallback(cbn) local fqn = identifier .. '.lb.' .. cbn local srcBook = prelude.getPriorityLoreBook(triggerId, fqn) -- 1. Source must not be empty if srcBook and srcBook.content ~= '' then local success, result = pcall(load, srcBook.content, '@' .. fqn, 't') -- 2. ": " .. tostring(result)) end end end local onInput = getCallback('onInput') if onInput then tbl.onInput = onInput() end local onOutput = getCallback('onOutput') if onOutput then tbl.onOutput = onOutput() end local mode = getGlobalVar(triggerId, "toggle_" .. identifier .. ":\n" .. response.result) alertError(triggerId, "[LightBoard] Failed to get LLM response for " .. manifest.identifier .. <style>
  @keyframes lb-slidein {
    0% {
      opacity: 0;
      transform: translateY(10px);
    }
    100% {
      opacity: 1;
      transform: translateY(0);
    }
  }

  .lb-module-root {
    align-items: flex-start;
    color: var(--fg, #f8f8f2);
    display: flex;
    gap: 8px;
    margin: 20px 0;
  }

  .lb-collapsible,
  .lb-lazyloader {
    flex-grow: 1;
    max-width: 700px;
    overflow: hidden;
  }

  .lb-lazyloader {
    filter: grayscale(35%);
    opacity: 0.5;
    transition: filter 0.2s ease, opacity 0.2s ease;
  }
  .lb-lazyloader:hover {
    filter: none;
    opacity: 1;
  }

  .lb-lazyloader svg {
    height: 14px;
    margin-left: 0.5ch;
    width: 14px;
  }

  .lb-collapsible-animated {
    --trans-duration: 0.2s;
  }
  .lb-collapsible-animated::details-content {
    transition-behavior: allow-discrete;
    transition-duration: var(--trans-duration);
    transition-property: opacity, transform, content-visibility;
  }
  .lb-collapsible-animated[open]::details-content {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateY(0);
    transition-timing-function: ease-out;
  }
  .lb-collapsible-animated:not([open])::details-content {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateY(-5px);
    transition-delay: 0s, 0.5s, 0s;
    transition-duration: var(--trans-duration);
    transition-timing-function: ease;
  }

  .lb-opener {
    background-color: var(--bg, #3a3c4eff);
    border: none;
    border-radius: 8px;
    color: var(--fg, #f8f8f2);
    cursor: pointer;
    display: flex;
    height: 36px;
    padding: 8px 16px;
    font-size: 1em;
    font-weight: 500;
    text-align: left;
    text-decoration: none;
    position: relative;
    overflow: hidden;
    width: 100%;
    user-select: none;
  }

  .lb-opener::before {
    content: '';
    inset: 0;
    position: absolute;
  }

  .lb-opener::after {
    content: '';
    display: block;
    flex-grow: 1;
    margin: -0.6em -1.2em -0.6em 1em;
    position: relative;
  }

  .lb-opener > span {
    align-items: center;
    display: flex;
    position: relative;
    z-index: 1;
  }
  .lb-opener > span::before {
    margin-right: 0.5ch;
  }
  .lb-opener > span::after {
    margin-left: 0.5ch;
    position: relative;
  }

  .lb-collapsible:not([open]) > .lb-opener > span::after {
    content: 'Î≥¥Í∏∞üî¶';
  }
  .lb-collapsible[open] > .lb-opener > span::after {
    content: 'Îã´Í∏∞üî¶';
  }

  @keyframes gentle-shake {
    0%,
    100% {
      transform: translate(0, 0);
    }
    10% {
      transform: translate(-1px, -1px);
    }
    20% {
      transform: translate(1px, 1px);
    }
    30% {
      transform: translate(-1px, 1px);
    }
    40% {
      transform: translate(1px, -1px);
    }
    50% {
      transform: translate(-0.5px, -0.5px);
    }
    60% {
      transform: translate(0.5px, 0.5px);
    }
    70% {
      transform: translate(-0.5px, 0.5px);
    }
    80% {
      transform: translate(0.5px, -0.5px);
    }
    90% {
      transform: translate(0, 0);
    }
  }

  .lb-reroll {
    align-items: center;
    background-color: var(--bg, #3a3c4eff);
    border-radius: 8px;
    color: var(--fg, #f8f8f2);
    display: flex;
    flex: 0 0 auto;
    font-size: 10px;
    height: 36px;
    justify-content: center;
    position: relative;
    width: 36px;
  }
  .lb-reroll:hover {
    animation: gentle-shake 0.5s ease-in-out;
  }

  .lb-reroll svg {
    width: 14px;
    height: 14px;
  }

  @keyframes beating {
    0% {
      opacity: 0;
      transform: translateX(-50%) scale(0);
    }
    10% {
      opacity: 1;
    }
    100% {
      opacity: 0;
      transform: translateX(-50%) scale(3);
    }
  }

  .lb-pending {
    border-radius: 8px;
    max-width: 700px;
    overflow: hidden;
    padding: 8px 16px;
    position: relative;
  }
  .lb-pending::before {
    background: var(--pending-bg-color, #05081a80);
    content: '';
    inset: 0;
    mix-blend-mode: multiply;
    position: absolute;
  }
  .lb-pending::after {
    animation: beating 3s ease-out;
    animation-iteration-count: infinite;
    background: var(--pending-pulse-color);
    border-radius: 256px;
    content: '';
    height: 256px;
    inset: 0 auto 0 0;
    margin: auto;
    width: 256px;
    position: absolute;
  }

  .lb-rerolling {
    --pending-pulse-color: red;
  }
  .lb-interacting {
    --pending-pulse-color: blue;
  }

  .lb-pending-note {
    color: #fff;
    position: relative;
    z-index: 1;
  }
  .lb-pending-note small {
    opacity: 0.67;
  }

  .lb-interacting-hint {
    display: block;
    margin-top: 8px;
  }

  .lb-dialog {
    animation: lb-slidein 0.2s ease forwards;
    background: none;
    bottom: 128px;
    height: fit-content;
    max-height: calc(100svh - 256px);
    max-width: 800px;
    opacity: 0;
    top: auto;
    width: 100%;
  }
  .lb-dialog:focus {
    outline: none;
  }
  .lb-dialog::backdrop {
    backdrop-filter: blur(4px);
    background: #0006;
  }

  @media (max-height: 1024px) {
    .lb-dialog {
      bottom: 64px;
      max-height: calc(100svh - 128px);
    }
  }

  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .lb-collapsible[open] + .lb-reroll {
      display: none;
    }

    .lb-opener {
      padding: 8px 12px;
    }

    .lb-dialog {
      bottom: 32px;
      max-height: calc(100svh - 64px);
    }
  }
</style>

lorebook.content:
identifier=lightboard-hn

authorsNote=false
charDesc=true
loreBooks=true
personaDesc=true

# Simulation details

## Protagonist

No posts from protagonist unless narrative stated. Passers-by (not partners) can post.

{{#if {{? {{getglobalvar::toggle_lightboard-hn.privacy}}=1}}}}
No contents resembling protagonist and engaging partners' locations and actions (same Gate, repairing same item, looting same monster, doing same quest).
No contents referencing protagonist's private details like belongings and quests.
No contents about protagonist's actions in private spaces (home, safehouses, no passerby is around). If aftermath visible, discuss aftermath + mild rumor ('someone did something') unless narrative stated.

Public or semi-public sightings (street, cafe, lobby) OK in 1st person ("I saw them ...", "(Blurry picture) I took ...").
Status rumors ("not seen lately," "heard injured?") OK anytime, limit to rumors not real details.
{{/if}}

## About the board

HunterNet (ÌóåÌÑ∞ÎÑ∑): Anon forum like DCInside for Awakened Hunters. Access: Hunter terminals, smartphones/PCs. Inaccessible in Gates.
Users aim for anonymity. Real IDs unknown unless linked to known online persona.
Nicks/content hinting at real-life roles (e.g., ÌòëÌöåÎÖ∏Ïòà, rank/class struggles) OK.

Posts/comments deleted for self-deletion or ToS violations (doxxing, classified info, hate speech, illegal, spam). Strong criticism, arguments, slang OK unless mods (Association staff/contracted Hunters) intervene.
Deleted post: (ÏÇ≠Ï†úÎêú Í≤åÏãúÎ¨ºÏûÖÎãàÎã§)
Deleted comment: (ÏÇ≠Ï†úÎêú ÎåìÍ∏ÄÏûÖÎãàÎã§)

NPCs (not Protagonist) can post/comment when not engaging Protagonist. Content reflects their personality.

All content: DCInside style - informal, casual, slang, memes, anon focus, sometimes crude/critical. Vulgar/low-class tone. Avoid periods.

### Nicknames

Guest nick format: Nick(xxx.yyy)
Assigned nick format: (F/S):Nick:(Rank)

Assigned nicks: F: Í≥†Ï†ïÎãâ, orange icon. S: Î∞òÍ≥†Ï†ïÎãâ, green icon.
Must postfix assigned nicks with hunter rank. Examples: S:Ïπ¥ÎçîÎùºÌÜµÏã†:B (semi, rank B). F:Îû≠Ïª§Íµ¨Í≤ΩÍæº:C (assigned, rank C).
No partial IP for assigned nicks.

Rank distribution: E/D very common; C frequent; B/A rare; S-ranks busy, appear for big events only. Users see assigned nicks' ranks; comments like "EÍ∏â Ï£ºÏ†úÏóê ÍπùÏπòÏßÄ ÎßàÎùº" or "AÍ∏âÏù¥ Ïôú Ïó¨Í∏∞ÏÑú Ïù¥Îü¨Í≥† ÏûàÏñ¥?" common. Guests have no rank visible. mocked as E-rank by high ranks.

Guest nicks: partial IP (Example: 118.235), mostly meaningless (many „Öá„Öá with different IPs, „ÖÅ„Ñ¥„Öá„Ñπ), no prefix/postfix.

Generate random community nicknames as if pulling them from pre-established pool of diverse user identities. Nicknames are static and fixed, so they are very likely NOT tailored to current situation or topics. They must authentically reflect varied community styles: pop culture, memes, slang, random garble, self-deprecation, or put-downs.
Examples: aaa(38.247), ÎßàÏÑùÍ¥ëÎ∂Ä, Îâ¥ÎπÑÏ†àÎã®Í∏∞, ÌèêÏßÄÏ§çÎäîDÍ∏â, Ïò§ÎäòÎèÑÌïúÎßàÎ¶¨(121.165), Ï†ïÎ≥¥)Í∏ÄÏì¥Ïù¥Î≥ëÏã†, Í∏ÅÌòîÎÉê?, ÏïåÎ∞î, „Öá„Öá(1.247), Ï£ºÏûëÏ¢ÄÍ∑∏Îßå, ÏÇ≠Ï†úÌï¥ÎùºÏï†ÏÜ°Ïù¥
These are examples. Invent NEW nicks.

May reuse highly relevant nicks from previous data. Keep the user speaking tone.

Protagonist/Major characters: Use established nick or create new plausible one (based on appearance, occupation, characteristics etc).

### Topics

Serious discussions (party strategy, skill builds, Gate info), questions, news, info sharing (drop locations, efficient farming routes), shitposting, memes, trolls, complaints (policies, Gates, teammates, rank), showing off rare drops or achievements (ÎπÑÌã±Ïßà).

Avoid topics from previous data. Previous data is embedded in log. No repeated similar topic/narrative discussions. Exception: Related post series with its own narrative progress. Series: preserve author's nick/tone from previous data.

Vary post topics. Include minimum one meme/troll/joke/shitpost. Invent plausible, small, everyday background events and topics based on universe settings. Note narrative time. Board users react with time gap, not instantly.

HunterNet = internet board, not broadcast. No civil alerts, no combat comms.

THIS WORLD IS NOT A GAME. HunterNet users are real Hunters who can die. They don't use game terms for their reality or view themselves as 'players'. Events discussed are actual narrative events, not fiction. Deaths/conflicts are real. No tutorial.

Time/Views/Upvotes: no obvious patterns (not multiples of 5, 10).

Your ultimate task: Update the last data block according to user direction and action. Subtly increase variable data (views, upvotes, relative time, etc). New data should also adhere to general guidelines and universe settings.

Action specifies what to do and which data to interact with. Other data are out of scope.

How to add comment: Keep all other textual data unchanged other than culling. Append a new comment according to user direction to post after all other comments. Generate and append reactions to the new comment (0~3 depending on public reception) from other users as well. Increase whole board's variable data subtly.

How to add post: Create new post as user directed. Keep all other textual data unchanged other than culling. Generate and append reactions to the new post (0~5 depending on public reception) from other users as well.

Increase whole board's existing variable data subtly. For any new entries, their variable data should reflect their fresh (but long enough to receive reactions) creation, not related to anything.

Common confusion: Replacing a post with one of its comment. Pay attention to not confuse and keep unrelated posts intact.

If direction lacks specified actor, treat as main protagonist(refer to universe settings)'s action, not random person. As user explicitly requested, disregard previous constraints about protagonist or characters not posting or commenting for whatever reason.

If direction is meaningless, take it and use it literally as the action's content. Do not try to assume.

If direction contains omissions, reactions should imagine the omitted content, not take it literally.

## Data Management and Contextual Responses

Beyond the specifically targeted post, identify and remove older, less relevant post if more posts exists than guideline specified length. This applies to comments too: Remove older, less relevant comments if too many in targeted post.
Less relevance: Low views/upvotes, long relative time without recent interaction, content completely unrelated (author-wise, content-wise, reaction-wise) to the current interaction.

Culling should be subtle: Maintain context. Limit it to few.

If contextually appropriate, generate new comments on existing posts (not just one targeted) to simulate ongoing activity and engagement within the board. These comments should logically follow existing conversations or react to older posts in plausible way.

# Generate NovelAI Tag Prompt for a Current Scene
> Goal: Create a NovelAI prompt string in `<lightboard-NAI>` format detailing the complete visual state (appearance, pose, expression, action, interaction) of all characters in a CURRENT SCENE as a frozen moment.

## Core Instructions:
0. Frozen Moment Constraint: All tags MUST depict a single, static visual instant‚Äîa snapshot in time.
1. Analyze for Visuals: Extract EVERY concrete, observable visual detail for ALL characters. If not present, MAKE THEM UP with DETAILS.
    * Appearance: Hair (`blonde hair`), Eyes (`red eyes`), Features (`ahoge`), Build (`large breasts`).
    * Attire: Clothing (`white school uniform`), Accessories (`black ribbon`).
    * Pose/Position: Basic Stance (`standing`, `sitting`), Specific Poses (`hand on hip`).
    * Expression: Clear tags (`smiling`, `tears`, `blush`). Avoid subjective terms.
    * Action/Interaction: What characters are doing to each other or to objects. Must be translated into NAI action tags for inter-character actions.
    * Objects: Significant items held or directly interacted with (`sword`, `book`).
2. Tag Generation Principles
    * Common Tags: Use widely found image board tags. Prioritize common, objective Danbooru tags.
    * Objective & Specific: Describe the visual elements present at one instant.
    * Actions/Interactions (in character sections):
        * Self-actions or actions on objects: Use standard tags (`holding sword`, `reading book`).
        * ALL interactions between characters MUST use NAI action tags:
            * `mutual#action_tag`: For genuinely reciprocal actions where all involved characters perform the same action towards each other (e.g., Character A & B both get `mutual#holding hands`).
            * `source#action_tag`: For the character performing a directional action (e.g., `source#patting head` for the one patting). MUST be paired with `target#action_tag` on the other character(s).
            * `target#action_tag`: For the character receiving a directional action (e.g., `target#patting head` for the one being patted). MUST be paired with `source#action_tag` on the acting character(s).
    * Explicit/NSFW Content: Accurately use common explicit tags/terms (e.g., `nude`, `sex`, `pussy`, `nsfw`. Use `nsfw` tag only when there is a direct visual exposure of nipples or genitals).
3. Video Prompt Principles
    * Prioritise user‚Äëdirected motion: Treat user instructions for action, body parts, interaction, style, or camera control as absolute law. Use image analysis only to support those instructions. If there‚Äôs a mismatch between the image‚Äôs pose and the requested motion, find a creative way to realise the user‚Äôs intent.
    * Describe subjects in detail: Start by describing the main character(s): appearance, attire, distinctive features, and emotional state. Include context elements not obvious in the image if needed.
    * Scene first, actions last: Open with a brief description of the environment, mood, and any static details (setting, lighting, style). Then place optional camera instructions. Conclude with a clear, sequenced description of specific actions and interactions.
    * Process‚Äëoriented motion: Focus on how the action unfolds rather than just outcomes. Specify which body parts move and how: ‚ÄúHer right hand lifts, palm open, waving energetically,‚Äù or ‚ÄúHe leans in, lips brush hers, arm wraps around her waist‚Äù. Use active verbs and avoid vague descriptors.
    * Action sequencing & weighting: For distinct actions, separate them with `|` to signal sequence (‚Äúshe raises her hand | she snaps her fingers | sparks fly‚Äù). Use weighting `(action:weight)` to emphasise intensity, speed, or duration on a particular action (values 1.1‚Äì2.0). For example, `(she turns slowly:1.5)` will lengthen the turn‚Äôs emphasis.
    * Emotions and expressions: Integrate changes in facial expressions and posture: ‚ÄúHer eyes widen in surprise, mouth forms a small ‚Äòo‚Äô,‚Äù ‚ÄúA smirk plays on his lips, brow arches inquisitively‚Äù. Emotional richness drives the narrative.
    * Aesthetic & temporal tags: Include lighting (‚Äúsoft moonlight,‚Äù ‚Äúharsh noon sun‚Äù), colour grade (‚Äúteal‚Äëand‚Äëorange,‚Äù ‚ÄúKodak Portra‚Äù), lens or style (‚Äúanamorphic bokeh,‚Äù ‚Äú16‚ÄØmm grain‚Äù), and time of day (sunrise, sunset) when relevant.
    * Camera defaults and control: Assume a static camera (no zoom, pan or tilt) unless user specifies otherwise. If stillness matters, state ‚Äústatic camera, no zoom.‚Äù Only add camera motions when they enhance the described actions.
    * Environmental reactions: Subtle background movement should complement or react to the main action (e.g., leaves rustling as someone turns). Do not rely solely on atmospheric motion.

      local attrs = {}  -- ÏÜçÏÑ±Îì§ÏùÑ Ï†ÄÏû•Ìï† ÌÖåÏù¥Î∏î
  
      -- Îî∞Ïò¥ÌëúÎ°ú ÎëòÎü¨Ïã∏Ïù∏ ÏÜçÏÑ± ÌååÏã± (Ïòà: attr="value")
      for key, quote, val in openTagContent:gmatch("([%w:_-]+)%s*=%s*(['\"])(.-)%2") do
        attrs[key] = val
      end
  
      -- Îî∞Ïò¥Ìëú ÏóÜÎäî ÏÜçÏÑ± ÌååÏã± (Ïòà: attr=value)
      for key, val in openTagContent:gmatch("([%w:_-]+)%s*=%s*([^%s\"'>]+)") do
        if not attrs[key] then attrs[key] = val end  -- Ïù¥ÎØ∏ ÌååÏã±Îêú ÏÜçÏÑ±Ïù¥ ÏóÜÏùÑ ÎïåÎßå Ï∂îÍ∞Ä
      end
  
      -- Ï¢ÖÎ£å ÌÉúÍ∑∏ Ï∞æÍ∏∞
      local closeStart, _ = text:find("</" .. tagName .. ">", tagEnd)
      if not closeStart then
        i = tagEnd + 1  -- Ï¢ÖÎ£å ÌÉúÍ∑∏Í∞Ä ÏóÜÏúºÎ©¥ Îã§Ïùå ÏúÑÏπòÎ°ú Ïù¥Îèô
        goto continue
      end
      local closeEnd = closeStart + #("</" .. tagNameRaw .. ">") - 1
  
      -- ÌÉúÍ∑∏ ÎÇ¥Ïö©Îßå Ï∂îÏ∂ú (ÏãúÏûë ÌÉúÍ∑∏ Ï¢ÖÎ£åÎ∂ÄÌÑ∞ Ï¢ÖÎ£å ÌÉúÍ∑∏ ÏãúÏûëÍπåÏßÄ)
      local contentOnly = text:sub(tagEnd + 1, closeStart - 1)
  
      -- Ï∂îÏ∂úÎêú ÎÖ∏Îìú Ï†ïÎ≥¥Î•º Í≤∞Í≥º Î∞∞Ïó¥Ïóê Ï∂îÍ∞Ä
      table.insert(results, {
        content    = contentOnly,    -- ÌÉúÍ∑∏ ÎÇ¥Î∂Ä ÎÇ¥Ïö©
        attributes = attrs,          -- ÌÉúÍ∑∏ ÏÜçÏÑ±Îì§
        rangeStart = startIdx,       -- ÏãúÏûë ÏúÑÏπò
        rangeEnd   = closeEnd        -- Ï¢ÖÎ£å ÏúÑÏπò
      })
  
      i = closeEnd + 1  -- Îã§Ïùå Í≤ÄÏÉâÏùÑ ÏúÑÌï¥ ÏúÑÏπò ÏóÖÎç∞Ïù¥Ìä∏
      ::continue::
    end
  
    return results
end
  
--- ÎåÄÍ¥ÑÌò∏ ÌÉúÍ∑∏ ÌòïÏãùÏùò Î∏îÎ°ùÎì§ÏùÑ Ï∂îÏ∂úÌïòÎäî Ìï®Ïàò
-- [Tag]ÏôÄ Îã§Ïùå [AnyTag] ÏÇ¨Ïù¥Ïùò ÎÇ¥Ïö©ÏùÑ Ï∂îÏ∂úÌï©ÎãàÎã§.
-- @param tag string Ï∂îÏ∂úÌï† ÌÉúÍ∑∏Î™Ö (Ïòà: "Char1", "Scene", "Place")
-- @param content string ÌååÏã±Ìï† Ï†ÑÏ≤¥ ÌÖçÏä§Ìä∏
-- @return string[] Ï∂îÏ∂úÎêú Î∏îÎ°ù ÎÇ¥Ïö©Îì§Ïùò Î∞∞Ïó¥
-- @example
--   extractBlocks("Char1", "[Char1]beautiful girl[Scene]outdoor[Char2]handsome boy")
--   -- Í≤∞Í≥º: {"beautiful girl"}
local function extractBlocks(tag, content)
    local results = {}                    -- Ï∂îÏ∂úÎêú Î∏îÎ°ùÎì§ÏùÑ Ï†ÄÏû•Ìï† Î∞∞Ïó¥
    local openTag = "[" .. tag .. "]"     -- Ï∞æÏùÑ ÌÉúÍ∑∏ ÌòïÏãù (Ïòà: "[Char1]")
    local pos = 1                         -- ÌòÑÏû¨ Í≤ÄÏÉâ ÏúÑÏπò
  
    -- ÌÖçÏä§Ìä∏ Ï†ÑÏ≤¥Î•º ÏàúÌöåÌïòÎ©∞ ÌÉúÍ∑∏Î•º Ï∞æÏùå
    while true do
      -- ÏßÄÏ†ïÎêú ÌÉúÍ∑∏ Ï∞æÍ∏∞ (Ï†ïÌôïÌïú Îß§Ïπò)
      local s, e = content:find(openTag, pos, true)
      if not s then break end  -- ÌÉúÍ∑∏Î•º Ï∞æÏßÄ Î™ªÌïòÎ©¥ Ï¢ÖÎ£å
  
      -- Îã§Ïùå ÎåÄÍ¥ÑÌò∏ ÌÉúÍ∑∏Ïùò ÏúÑÏπòÎ•º Ï∞æÏïÑ Î∏îÎ°ùÏùò ÎÅùÏùÑ Í≤∞Ï†ï
      local nextBracketPos = content:find("%[%w+%]", e + 1)
      local blockContent
      
      if nextBracketPos then
        -- Îã§Ïùå ÌÉúÍ∑∏Í∞Ä ÏûàÏúºÎ©¥ Í∑∏ Ïù¥Ï†ÑÍπåÏßÄÏùò ÎÇ¥Ïö© Ï∂îÏ∂ú
        blockContent = content:sub(e + 1, nextBracketPos - 1)
      else
        -- Îã§Ïùå ÌÉúÍ∑∏Í∞Ä ÏóÜÏúºÎ©¥ ÎÅùÍπåÏßÄÏùò ÎÇ¥Ïö© Ï∂îÏ∂ú
        blockContent = content:sub(e + 1)
      end
      
      -- Ï∂îÏ∂úÎêú Î∏îÎ°ù ÎÇ¥Ïö©ÏùÑ Í≤∞Í≥º Î∞∞Ïó¥Ïóê Ï∂îÍ∞Ä
      table.insert(results, blockContent)
      
      if nextBracketPos then
        pos = nextBracketPos  -- Îã§Ïùå Í≤ÄÏÉâÏùÑ ÏúÑÌï¥ ÏúÑÏπò ÏóÖÎç∞Ïù¥Ìä∏
      else
        break  -- Îçî Ïù¥ÏÉÅ ÌÉúÍ∑∏Í∞Ä ÏóÜÏúºÎ©¥ Ï¢ÖÎ£å
      end
    end
  
    return results
end
  
-- ============================================================================
-- NAI ÏΩòÌÖêÏ∏† ÌååÏã± Ìï®ÏàòÎì§
-- ============================================================================

--- NAI LightBoard ÏΩòÌÖêÏ∏†Î•º Íµ¨Ï°∞ÌôîÎêú Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞Î°ú ÌååÏã±ÌïòÎäî Ìï®Ïàò
-- [Char1], [Char2], [Scene], [Place], [Angle] Îì±Ïùò ÌÉúÍ∑∏Î•º ÌååÏã±ÌïòÏó¨ Íµ¨Ï°∞ÌôîÎêú Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞Î°ú Î≥ÄÌôò
-- @param content string ÌååÏã±Ìï† NAI ÏΩòÌÖêÏ∏†
-- @return table Íµ¨Ï°∞ÌôîÎêú Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞:
--   {
--     characters = {[1] = {tags="Ï∫êÎ¶≠ÌÑ∞1 ÌÉúÍ∑∏", label="Char1"}, ...},
--     scene = "Ïû•Î©¥ ÏÑ§Î™Ö",
--     place = "Ïû•ÏÜå ÏÑ§Î™Ö", 
--     angle = "Í∞ÅÎèÑ ÏÑ§Î™Ö"
--   }
-- @example
--   parseNAIContent("[Char1]beautiful girl[Scene]outdoor[Place]park[Angle]close-up")
--   -- Í≤∞Í≥º: {characters={{tags="beautiful girl", label="Char1"}}, scene="outdoor", place="park", angle="close-up"}
local function parseNAIContent(content)
    local data = {}  -- ÌååÏã±Îêú Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞Î•º Ï†ÄÏû•Ìï† ÌÖåÏù¥Î∏î
    
    -- Ï∫êÎ¶≠ÌÑ∞ Î∏îÎ°ùÎì§ Ï∂îÏ∂ú (Char1, Char2, Char3, ...)
    data.characters = {}
    local charNum = 1  -- Ï∫êÎ¶≠ÌÑ∞ Î≤àÌò∏ (1Î∂ÄÌÑ∞ ÏãúÏûë)
    
    while true do
      local charTag = "Char" .. charNum  -- "Char1", "Char2", ...
      local charBlocks = extractBlocks(charTag, content)
      
      if #charBlocks == 0 then 
        break  -- Îçî Ïù¥ÏÉÅ Ï∫êÎ¶≠ÌÑ∞ Î∏îÎ°ùÏù¥ ÏóÜÏúºÎ©¥ Ï¢ÖÎ£å
      end
      
      -- Ï∫êÎ¶≠ÌÑ∞ Ï†ïÎ≥¥Î•º Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞Ïóê Ï†ÄÏû•
      data.characters[charNum] = {
        tags = trim(charBlocks[1]),  -- Ï∫êÎ¶≠ÌÑ∞ ÌÉúÍ∑∏ (Í≥µÎ∞± Ï†úÍ±∞)
        label = charTag              -- Ï∫êÎ¶≠ÌÑ∞ ÎùºÎ≤® (Char1, Char2, ...)
      }
      charNum = charNum + 1  -- Îã§Ïùå Ï∫êÎ¶≠ÌÑ∞Î°ú Ïù¥Îèô
    end
    
    -- Ïû•Î©¥(Scene) Î∏îÎ°ù Ï∂îÏ∂ú
    local sceneBlocks = extractBlocks("Scene", content)
    if #sceneBlocks > 0 then
      data.scene = trim(sceneBlocks[1])  -- Ï≤´ Î≤àÏß∏ Ïû•Î©¥ Î∏îÎ°ùÏùò ÎÇ¥Ïö©
    end
    
    -- Ïû•ÏÜå(Place) Î∏îÎ°ù Ï∂îÏ∂ú
    local placeBlocks = extractBlocks("Place", content)
    if #placeBlocks > 0 then
      data.place = trim(placeBlocks[1])  -- Ï≤´ Î≤àÏß∏ Ïû•ÏÜå Î∏îÎ°ùÏùò ÎÇ¥Ïö©
    end
    
    -- Í∞ÅÎèÑ(Angle) Î∏îÎ°ù Ï∂îÏ∂ú
    local angleBlocks = extractBlocks("Angle", content)
    if #angleBlocks > 0 then
      data.angle = trim(angleBlocks[1])  -- Ï≤´ Î≤àÏß∏ Í∞ÅÎèÑ Î∏îÎ°ùÏùò ÎÇ¥Ïö©
    end

    -- ÏòÅÏÉÅ(Video) Î∏îÎ°ù Ï∂îÏ∂ú
    local videoBlocks = extractBlocks("Video", content)
    if #videoBlocks > 0 then
      data.video = trim(videoBlocks[1])  -- Ï≤´ Î≤àÏß∏ Í∞ÅÎèÑ Î∏îÎ°ùÏùò ÎÇ¥Ïö©
    end
    
    return data
end
  
--- ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖã ÏÑ§Ï†ïÏùÑ Í∞ÄÏ†∏Ïò§Îäî Ìï®Ïàò
-- Ï†ÑÏó≠ Î≥ÄÏàòÏóêÏÑú ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖã Î≤àÌò∏Î•º ÏùΩÍ≥†, Ìï¥Îãπ ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖãÏùò Author, Quality, Negative Ï†ïÎ≥¥Î•º Ï∂îÏ∂ú
-- @param triggerId string Ìä∏Î¶¨Í±∞ ID
-- @return string, string, string Author, Quality, Negative ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖã Í∞íÎì§
-- @example
--   getPreset("trigger123")
--   -- ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖã ÎÇ¥Ïö©: "[Author]masterpiece[Quality]best quality[Negative]low quality"
--   -- Í≤∞Í≥º: "masterpiece", "best quality", "low quality"
local function getPreset(triggerId)
    -- Ï†ÑÏó≠ Î≥ÄÏàòÏóêÏÑú ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖã Î≤àÌò∏ Í∞ÄÏ†∏Ïò§Í∏∞
    local presetNumStr = getGlobalVar(triggerId, "toggle_lightboard-NAI.presetNum")
    local presetNum = 1  -- Í∏∞Î≥∏ ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖã Î≤àÌò∏
  
    -- ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖã Î≤àÌò∏Í∞Ä Ïú†Ìö®ÌïúÏßÄ ÌôïÏù∏ÌïòÍ≥† ÏÑ§Ï†ï
    if presetNumStr and presetNumStr ~= "null" and presetNumStr ~= "" then
      local num = tonumber(presetNumStr)
      if num and num > 0 then
        presetNum = math.floor(num)  -- ÏñëÏùò Ï†ïÏàòÎ°ú Î≥ÄÌôò
      end
    end
  
    -- ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖã ÌÇ§ ÏÉùÏÑ± (Ïòà: "ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖã1", "ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖã2")
    local presetKey = "ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖã" .. presetNum
    local presetEntries = getLoreBooks(triggerId, presetKey)
    
    -- Í∏∞Î≥∏Í∞íÎì§ Ï¥àÍ∏∞Ìôî
    local author = ""
    local quality = ""
    local negative = ""
  
    -- ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖãÏù¥ Ï°¥Ïû¨ÌïòÏßÄ ÏïäÍ±∞ÎÇò ÎÇ¥Ïö©Ïù¥ ÎπÑÏñ¥ÏûàÎäî Í≤ΩÏö∞ Ï≤òÎ¶¨
    if not presetEntries or #presetEntries == 0 or not presetEntries[1] or not presetEntries[1].content then
      print("[LightBoard] NAI: Preset \'" .. presetKey .. "\' not found or its content is empty.")
      return author, quality, negative  -- Í∏∞Î≥∏ Îπà Î¨∏ÏûêÏó¥Îì§ Î∞òÌôò
    end
    
    local presetContent = presetEntries[1].content
    
    -- [Author] ÌÉúÍ∑∏ÏóêÏÑú ÏûëÍ∞Ä Ï†ïÎ≥¥ Ï∂îÏ∂ú
    local authorMatch = presetContent:match("%[Author%]%s*([^\r\n]*)")
    if authorMatch then
      author = trim(authorMatch)
    end
  
    -- [Quality] ÌÉúÍ∑∏ÏóêÏÑú ÌíàÏßà Ï†ïÎ≥¥ Ï∂îÏ∂ú
    local qualityMatch = presetContent:match("%[Quality%]%s*([^\r\n]*)")
    if qualityMatch then
      quality = trim(qualityMatch)
    end
  
    -- [Negative] ÌÉúÍ∑∏ÏóêÏÑú ÎÑ§Í±∞Ìã∞Î∏å ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏ Ï∂îÏ∂ú
    local negativeMatch = presetContent:match("%[Negative%]%s*([^\r\n]*)")
    if negativeMatch then
      negative = trim(negativeMatch)
    end
  
    -- ÌïÑÏàò ÌÉúÍ∑∏Í∞Ä ÎàÑÎùΩÎêú Í≤ΩÏö∞ ÏóêÎü¨ Ï≤òÎ¶¨
    if presetContent and presetContent ~= "" and (not authorMatch or not qualityMatch or not negativeMatch) then
      local missingTags = {}
      if not authorMatch then table.insert(missingTags, "Author") end
      if not qualityMatch then table.insert(missingTags, "Quality") end
      if not negativeMatch then table.insert(missingTags, "Negative") end
      
      local errorMessage = "ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖã ÎÇ¥Ïö© ÌòïÏãùÏùÑ ÌôïÏù∏Ìï¥Ï£ºÏÑ∏Ïöî. Îã§Ïùå ÌïÑÏàò ÌÉúÍ∑∏Î•º Ï∞æÏùÑ Ïàò ÏóÜÏäµÎãàÎã§: " .. table.concat(missingTags, ", ")
      alertError(triggerId, errorMessage)
      print("[LightBoard] NAI: Preset \'" .. presetKey .. "\' is missing tags: " .. table.concat(missingTags, ", ") .. ". Content: " .. presetContent)
    end
    
    return author, quality, negative
end
  
-- ============================================================================
-- ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏ ÏÉùÏÑ± Ìï®ÏàòÎì§
-- ============================================================================

--- NAI Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄ ÏÉùÏÑ±ÏùÑ ÏúÑÌïú ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏Î•º ÏÉùÏÑ±ÌïòÎäî Ìï®Ïàò
-- ÌååÏã±Îêú Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞ÏôÄ ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖãÏùÑ Ï°∞Ìï©ÌïòÏó¨ ÏµúÏ¢Ö ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏Î•º ÏÉùÏÑ±
-- @param triggerId string Ìä∏Î¶¨Í±∞ ID
-- @param characters table Ï∫êÎ¶≠ÌÑ∞ Ï†ïÎ≥¥ Î∞∞Ïó¥
-- @param scene string Ïû•Î©¥ ÏÑ§Î™Ö
-- @param place string Ïû•ÏÜå ÏÑ§Î™Ö
-- @param angle string Í∞ÅÎèÑ ÏÑ§Î™Ö
-- @param video string ÏòÅÏÉÅ ÏÑ§Î™Ö
-- @return string, string positivePrompt, negativePrompt
-- @example
--   getPrompt("trigger123", {{tags="beautiful girl"}}, "outdoor", "park", "close-up")
--   -- Í≤∞Í≥º: "masterpiece, outdoor, park, close-up, best quality | beautiful girl", "low quality"
local function getPrompt(triggerId, characters, scene, place, angle, video)
    -- ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÏÖãÏóêÏÑú Í∏∞Î≥∏ Ï†ïÎ≥¥ Í∞ÄÏ†∏Ïò§Í∏∞
    local author, quality, negative = getPreset(triggerId)
    local promptParts = {}  -- ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏ Íµ¨ÏÑ± ÏöîÏÜåÎì§ÏùÑ Ï†ÄÏû•Ìï† Î∞∞Ïó¥
    
    -- ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏ Íµ¨ÏÑ± ÏöîÏÜåÎì§ÏùÑ ÏàúÏÑúÎåÄÎ°ú Ï∂îÍ∞Ä
    if author and author ~= "" then table.insert(promptParts, author) end
    if scene and scene ~= "" then table.insert(promptParts, scene) end
    if place and place ~= "" then table.insert(promptParts, place) end
    if angle and angle ~= "" then table.insert(promptParts, angle) end
    if video and video ~= "" then table.insert(promptParts, video) end
    if quality and quality ~= "" then table.insert(promptParts, quality) end
    
    -- Í∏∞Î≥∏ ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏ ÏÉùÏÑ± (ÏâºÌëúÎ°ú Íµ¨Î∂Ñ)
    local positivePrompt = table.concat(promptParts, ", ")

    -- Ï∫êÎ¶≠ÌÑ∞ Ï†ïÎ≥¥Í∞Ä ÏûàÎäî Í≤ΩÏö∞ Ï≤òÎ¶¨
    if characters and #characters > 0 then
      local charPrompts = {}  -- Ï∫êÎ¶≠ÌÑ∞ ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏Îì§ÏùÑ Ï†ÄÏû•Ìï† Î∞∞Ïó¥
      
      -- Í∞Å Ï∫êÎ¶≠ÌÑ∞Ïùò ÌÉúÍ∑∏Î•º ÏàòÏßë
      for i, char in ipairs(characters) do
        if char.tags and char.tags ~= "" then
          table.insert(charPrompts, char.tags)
        end
      end
      
      -- Ï∫êÎ¶≠ÌÑ∞ ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏Í∞Ä ÏûàÎäî Í≤ΩÏö∞ Í∏∞Î≥∏ ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏ÏôÄ Í≤∞Ìï©
      if #charPrompts > 0 then
        if positivePrompt ~= "" then
          -- Í∏∞Î≥∏ ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏Í∞Ä ÏûàÏúºÎ©¥ " | "Î°ú Íµ¨Î∂ÑÌïòÏó¨ Ï∂îÍ∞Ä
          positivePrompt = positivePrompt .. " | " .. table.concat(charPrompts, " | ")
        else
          -- Í∏∞Î≥∏ ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏Í∞Ä ÏóÜÏúºÎ©¥ Ï∫êÎ¶≠ÌÑ∞ ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏Îßå ÏÇ¨Ïö©
          positivePrompt = table.concat(charPrompts, " | ")
        end
      end
    end
    
    -- ÎÑ§Í±∞Ìã∞Î∏å ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏ ÏÑ§Ï†ï
    local negativePrompt = negative
    
    -- Ï∂îÍ∞Ä Ìè¨ÏßÄÌã∞Î∏å ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏Í∞Ä ÏûàÎäîÏßÄ ÌôïÏù∏
    local addPositive = getChatVar(triggerId, "lb-nai-addPositive")
    
    if addPositive ~= "null" and addPositive ~= "" then
      -- Ï∂îÍ∞Ä ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏Î•º Îß® ÏïûÏóê Ï∂îÍ∞Ä
      positivePrompt = addPositive .. ", " .. positivePrompt
    end
    
    -- Í¥ÑÌò∏Î•º Ïù¥Ïä§ÏºÄÏù¥ÌîÑÌïòÏó¨ NovelAIÍ∞Ä ()Î•º {}Î°ú Î≥ÄÌôòÌïòÎäî Í≤ÉÏùÑ Î∞©ÏßÄ
    positivePrompt = string.gsub(positivePrompt, "%(", "\\(")
    positivePrompt = string.gsub(positivePrompt, "%)", "\\)")
    
    return positivePrompt, negativePrompt
end
  
-- ============================================================================
-- Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄ ÏÉùÏÑ± Ìï®ÏàòÎì§
-- ============================================================================

--- NAI Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞Î°úÎ∂ÄÌÑ∞ Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄÎ•º ÏÉùÏÑ±ÌïòÎäî ÎπÑÎèôÍ∏∞ Ìï®Ïàò
-- ÏÉùÏÑ±Îêú ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏Î•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÏó¨ Ïã§Ï†ú Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄÎ•º ÏÉùÏÑ±ÌïòÍ≥† Í≤∞Í≥ºÎ•º Î∞òÌôò
-- @param triggerId string Ìä∏Î¶¨Í±∞ ID
-- @param positivePrompt string Ìè¨ÏßÄÌã∞Î∏å ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏
-- @param negativePrompt string ÎÑ§Í±∞Ìã∞Î∏å ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏
-- @return string|nil ÏÉùÏÑ±Îêú Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄ Í≤∞Í≥º ÎòêÎäî nil (Ïã§Ìå® Ïãú)
-- @example
--   generateImageFromNAI("trigger123", "beautiful girl, masterpiece", "low quality")
--   -- Í≤∞Í≥º: "base64_image_data" ÎòêÎäî nil
local generateImageFromNAI = async(function(triggerId, positivePrompt, negativePrompt)
    print("[LightBoard] NAI: Generating image with prompt: " .. positivePrompt)

    -- generateImage Ìï®ÏàòÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÏó¨ Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄ ÏÉùÏÑ±
    local imageResult
    local success, result = pcall(function()
      -- ÎπÑÎèôÍ∏∞ Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄ ÏÉùÏÑ± Ìï®Ïàò Ìò∏Ï∂ú Î∞è ÎåÄÍ∏∞
      imageResult = generateImage(triggerId, positivePrompt, negativePrompt):await()
      print("[LightBoard] NAI: Image generation result: " .. tostring(imageResult))
      return true
    end)
    
    -- Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄ ÏÉùÏÑ± ÏÑ±Í≥µ/Ïã§Ìå® Ï≤òÎ¶¨
    if success and imageResult then
      print("[LightBoard] NAI: Image generated successfully")
      return imageResult  -- ÏÉùÏÑ±Îêú Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄ Í≤∞Í≥º Î∞òÌôò
    else
      print("[LightBoard] NAI: Image generation failed: " .. tostring(result))
      return nil  -- Ïã§Ìå® Ïãú nil Î∞òÌôò
    end
end)
  
-- ============================================================================
-- Î©îÏù∏ Ï≤òÎ¶¨ Ìï®Ïàò
-- ============================================================================

--- LightBoard NAI Î™®ÎìàÏùò Î©îÏù∏ Ï∂úÎ†• Ï≤òÎ¶¨ Ìï®Ïàò
-- AI Ï∂úÎ†•ÏóêÏÑú lightboard-NAI ÌÉúÍ∑∏Î•º Í∞êÏßÄÌïòÍ≥† Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄ ÏÉùÏÑ±ÏùÑ Ï≤òÎ¶¨ÌïòÎäî ÌïµÏã¨ Ìï®Ïàò
-- @param triggerId string Ìä∏Î¶¨Í±∞ ID
-- @param output string AIÏùò ÏõêÎ≥∏ Ï∂úÎ†• ÌÖçÏä§Ìä∏
-- @return string Ï≤òÎ¶¨Îêú Ï∂úÎ†• ÌÖçÏä§Ìä∏ (Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄ ÌÉúÍ∑∏ Ìè¨Ìï®)
-- @example
--   onOutput("trigger123", "<lightboard-NAI>[Char1]beautiful girl[Scene]outdoor</lightboard-NAI>")
--   -- Í≤∞Í≥º: "<lightboard-NAI>[Char1]beautiful girl[Scene]outdoor</lightboard-NAI>\n<lb-NAIimg>base64_image_data</lb-NAIimg>"
local onOutput = async(function(triggerId, output)
    -- 1Îã®Í≥Ñ: lightboard-NAI Î∏îÎ°ù Ï∂îÏ∂ú
    local success, naiBlocks = pcall(extractAllNodes, "lightboard-NAI", output)
    
    -- lightboard-NAI Î∏îÎ°ùÏù¥ ÏóÜÍ±∞ÎÇò ÎÇ¥Ïö©Ïù¥ ÎπÑÏñ¥ÏûàÎäî Í≤ΩÏö∞ Ï≤òÎ¶¨
    if not success or not naiBlocks or #naiBlocks == 0 or not naiBlocks[#naiBlocks].content or trim(naiBlocks[#naiBlocks].content) == "" then
      return "<lb-lazy identifier=\"lightboard-NAI\"></lb-lazy>"  -- ÏßÄÏó∞ Î°úÎî© ÌÉúÍ∑∏ Î∞òÌôò
    end

    -- ÎßàÏßÄÎßâ lightboard-NAI Î∏îÎ°ùÏùò ÎÇ¥Ïö© Ï∂îÏ∂ú
    local block = naiBlocks[#naiBlocks].content or ""
    
    -- Í∏∞Î≥∏ Ï∂úÎ†• Íµ¨ÏÑ± (lightboard-NAI ÌÉúÍ∑∏Î°ú Í∞êÏã∏Í∏∞)
    local refinedOutput = "<lightboard-NAI>" .. block .. "</lightboard-NAI>"

    -- 2Îã®Í≥Ñ: lb-process Î∏îÎ°ù Ï∂îÏ∂ú (Ï≤òÎ¶¨ Í≥ºÏ†ï ÌëúÏãúÏö©)
    local success, thinkBlocks = pcall(extractAllNodes, "lb-process", output)
    
    -- lb-process Î∏îÎ°ùÏù¥ ÏûàÏúºÎ©¥ Ï≤òÎ¶¨ Í≥ºÏ†ïÏùÑ Ï∂úÎ†•Ïóê Ìè¨Ìï®
    if success and thinkBlocks and #thinkBlocks > 0 and thinkBlocks[#thinkBlocks].content then
      refinedOutput = "<lb-process>" .. thinkBlocks[#thinkBlocks].content .. "</lb-process>\n" .. refinedOutput
    end

    -- 3Îã®Í≥Ñ: Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄ ÏÉùÏÑ± ÎπÑÌôúÏÑ±Ìôî ÌôïÏù∏
    if getGlobalVar(triggerId, "toggle_lightboard-NAI.imagen") == "1" then
      return refinedOutput  -- Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄ ÏÉùÏÑ±Ïù¥ ÎπÑÌôúÏÑ±ÌôîÎêú Í≤ΩÏö∞ Í∏∞Î≥∏ Ï∂úÎ†•Îßå Î∞òÌôò
    end
    
    -- 4Îã®Í≥Ñ: NAI ÏΩòÌÖêÏ∏† ÌååÏã±
    local parseSuccess, naiData = pcall(parseNAIContent, block)
    if parseSuccess then
      -- 5Îã®Í≥Ñ: ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏ ÏÉùÏÑ±
      local promptSuccess, positivePrompt, negativePrompt = pcall(getPrompt, triggerId, naiData.characters, naiData.scene, naiData.place, naiData.angle)
      if promptSuccess then          
        -- 6Îã®Í≥Ñ: Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄ ÏÉùÏÑ±
        local imageResult = generateImageFromNAI(triggerId, positivePrompt, negativePrompt):await()
        if imageResult then
          -- ÏÉùÏÑ±Îêú Ïù¥ÎØ∏ÏßÄÎ•º Ï∂úÎ†•Ïóê Ï∂îÍ∞Ä
          refinedOutput = refinedOutput .. "\n<lb-NAIimg>" .. imageResult .. "</lb-NAIimg>"
        end
      else
        print("[LightBoard] NAI onOutput: Failed to get prompt:", tostring(negativePrompt))
      end
    else
      print("[LightBoard] NAI onOutput: Failed to parse NAI content:", tostring(naiData))
    end

    return refinedOutput
end)
  
  return onOutput

-- ============================================================================

1 for i = reloadIdx, reloadIdx - 2, -1 do if i < 1 then break end reloadChat(triggerId, i) end end ---Î†åÎçîÎßÅ Ïù∏Îç±Ïä§Î•º Í≥ÑÏÇ∞ÌïòÎäî Ìï®Ïàò ---Ï±ÑÌåÖ Í∏∏Ïù¥ÏóêÏÑú Î†åÎçîÎßÅ Í±∞Î¶¨Î•º Î∫Ä Ïù∏Îç±Ïä§Î•º Î∞òÌôò ---@param triggerId string Ìä∏Î¶¨Í±∞ ID (ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ïûê ÏÑ∏ÏÖò ÏãùÎ≥ÑÏûê) ---@return number Î†åÎçîÎßÅÌï† ÏãúÏûë Ïù∏Îç±Ïä§ ---@example --- getRenderIdx("user123") -> 5 (Ï±ÑÌåÖ Í∏∏Ïù¥Í∞Ä 15Ïù¥Í≥† renderDistÍ∞Ä 10Ïù∏ Í≤ΩÏö∞) function getRenderIdx(triggerId) local renderDist = getGlobalVar(triggerId, "toggle_lightboard-NAI.renderDist") if not renderDist or renderDist == "null" or renderDist == "" then renderDist = 10 end return getChatLength(triggerId) - lorebook.content:
{{#if {{? {{getglobalvar::toggle_DNDNEWBLONG}}=1}}}}
## D&D Dictionary
- Output the D&D Dictionary interface data based on the format and constraints below in Korean - at the very bottom every time. IT MUST ALWAYS BE ADDED AT THE END!
- An interface created to aid D&D player with Magic, Features, and Location/Faction information. 
- The Dictionary MUST print all the Magic, Important Facts about Location/Faction, and Features in the player status. 
- Print the Magic name, Spell effect, damage dice, and higher level casting info; Feature definition in this format; Wiki-like information about the current location and factions in the location.
Do not write in Korean for section dividers (CAPITAL LETTERS).

Format:
DIC[MAG: magicName|MINFO: Magic Info|...|FEAT: FeatureName|FINFO:Feat information|LOC: name of the current location or factions present in the location|LINFO: information about the current location or factions present in the location]

EX: 
DIC[MAG: ÌååÏù¥Ïñ¥Î≥º|MINFO: (3Î†àÎ≤® Ï£ºÎ¨∏ / Î∞©Ï∂ú) ÎØºÏ≤© ÎÇ¥ÏÑ± Íµ¥Î¶ºÏù¥ ÌïÑÏöîÌï©ÎãàÎã§. 20ÌîºÌä∏ Î∞òÍ≤Ω ÎÇ¥Ïóê 8d6 ÌîºÌï¥Î•º ÏûÖÌûôÎãàÎã§. 4Î†àÎ≤® Ïù¥ÏÉÅÏùò Ï£ºÎ¨∏ Ïä¨Î°ØÏùÑ ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÎ©¥ Ïä¨Î°Ø Î†àÎ≤®Îãπ ÌîºÌï¥Í∞Ä 1d6Ïî© Ï¶ùÍ∞ÄÌï©ÎãàÎã§.|FEAT: Í±∞ÎåÄ Î¨¥Í∏∞ Ï†ÑÎ¨∏Í∞Ä|FINFO: Î¨¥Í∏∞Ïùò Î¨¥Í≤åÎ•º ÌôúÏö©ÌïòÏó¨ Í≥µÍ≤©ÏùÑ Í∞ïÌôîÌïòÎäî Î≤ïÏùÑ ÏùµÌòîÏäµÎãàÎã§. Î¨¥Í±∞Ïö¥ Î¨¥Í∏∞Î°ú Í∑ºÏ†ë Í≥µÍ≤©ÏùÑ ÌïòÍ∏∞ Ï†ÑÏóê Î™ÖÏ§ë Íµ¥Î¶ºÏóê -5 Ìå®ÎÑêÌã∞Î•º ÏÑ†ÌÉùÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§. Í≥µÍ≤©Ïù¥ Î™ÖÏ§ëÌïòÎ©¥ ÌîºÌï¥Ïóê +10ÏùÑ Ï∂îÍ∞ÄÌï©ÎãàÎã§.|LOC:ÏõåÌÑ∞Îî•|LINFO: ÏõåÌÑ∞Îî•ÏùÄ Ìè¨Í∞ÄÌäº Î†êÎ¶Ñ ÏÑ∏Í≥ÑÏóêÏÑú Í∞ÄÏû• ÌÅ¨Í≥† Î≤àÏòÅÌïú ÎèÑÏãú Ï§ë ÌïòÎÇòÎ°ú, Î¨¥Ïó≠, Î™®Ìóò, Í∑∏Î¶¨Í≥† Ï†ïÏπòÏùò Ï§ëÏã¨ÏßÄÏûÖÎãàÎã§.]
{{/if}}

{{#if {{? {{getglobalvar::toggle_DNDNEWBSHORT}}=1}}}}
## Forgotten Realms Dictionary
- Output the Forgotten Realms  Dictionary interface data based on the format and constraints below in Korean - at the very bottom every time. IT MUST ALWAYS BE ADDED AT THE END!
- An interface created to aid D&D player with  Location/Faction information. 
- The Dictionary MUST print all the Important Facts about Location/Faction. 
- Print a wiki-like information about the current location and factions in the location.
Do not write in Korean for section dividers (CAPITAL LETTERS).

Format:
DIC[LOC: name of the current location or factions present in the location|LINFO: information about the current location or factions present in the location]

EX: 
DIC[LOC:ÏõåÌÑ∞Îî•|LINFO: ÏõåÌÑ∞Îî•ÏùÄ Ìè¨Í∞ÄÌäº Î†êÎ¶Ñ ÏÑ∏Í≥ÑÏóêÏÑú Í∞ÄÏû• ÌÅ¨Í≥† Î≤àÏòÅÌïú ÎèÑÏãú Ï§ë ÌïòÎÇòÎ°ú, Î¨¥Ïó≠, Î™®Ìóò, Í∑∏Î¶¨Í≥† Ï†ïÏπòÏùò Ï§ëÏã¨ÏßÄÏûÖÎãàÎã§.]
{{/if}}

effect.code:
--[[ DND Information Parser - Handles DIC[...] markup for D&D magic, features, and factions - Parse DIC[...] blocks to extract D&D game information - Tab-based navigation between Magic, Features, and Factions - Scrollable content areas for readability - Clean visual display with expandable entries - UTF-8 safe text handling --]] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -- Constants ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- local CATEGORIES = { MAG = { name = "Magic", cssClass = "tab-magic", icon = "‚ú®" }, FEAT = { name = "Features", cssClass = "tab-features", icon = "‚öîÔ∏è" }, FACT = { name = "Factions", cssClass = "tab-factions", icon = "üèõÔ∏è" } } ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -- Helper Functions ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -- Trim whitespace from string local function trim(str) if not str then return "" end return string.gsub(string.gsub(str, "^%s+", ""), "%s+$", "") end -- Escape HTML special characters local function escapeHtml(str) if not str or str == "" then return "" end str = string.gsub(str, "&", "&") str = string.gsub(str, "<", "<") str = string.gsub(str, ">", ">") str = string.gsub(str, "\"", """) str = string.gsub(str, "'", "'") return str end ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -- Core Logic Functions ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -- 1. Extract all DIC[...] blocks from text local function extractAllDicBlocks(text) local results = {} local i = 1 while true do local startIdx, prefixEnd = text:find("DIC%[", i) if not startIdx then break end local bracketLevel = 1 local endIdx = prefixEnd + 1 local searchEnd = #text while endIdx <= searchEnd do local char = text:sub(endIdx, endIdx) if char == "[" then bracketLevel = bracketLevel + 1 elseif char == "]" then bracketLevel = bracketLevel - 1 end if bracketLevel == 0 then break end endIdx = endIdx + 1 end if bracketLevel == 0 then local contentOnly = text:sub(prefixEnd + 1, endIdx - 1) table.insert(results, { content = contentOnly, rangeStart = startIdx, rangeEnd = endIdx }) i = endIdx + 1 else i = prefixEnd + 1 end end return results end -- 2. Parse DIC block content local function parseDicContent(raw_content) local magics = {} local features = {} local factions = {} local segments = {} for seg in string.gmatch(raw_content, "([^|]+)") do table.insert(segments, seg) end local i = 1 local currentType = nil local currentItem = nil while i <= #segments do local segment = segments[i] local prefix, value = segment:match("^([%u_]+):%s*(.+)$") if prefix and value then value = trim(value) if prefix == "MAG" then currentType = "magic" currentItem = { name = value, info = "" } table.insert(magics, currentItem) i = i + 1 elseif prefix == "MINFO" and currentType == "magic" and currentItem then currentItem.info = value i = i + 1 elseif prefix == "FEAT" then currentType = "feature" currentItem = { name = value, info = "" } table.insert(features, currentItem) i = i + 1 elseif prefix == "FINFO" and (currentType == "feature" or currentType == "faction") and currentItem then currentItem.info = value i = i + 1 elseif prefix == "FACT" then currentType = "faction" currentItem = { name = "Location/Faction Info", info = value } table.insert(factions, currentItem) i = i + 1 -- Support for LOC and FAC prefixes elseif prefix == "LOC" then currentType = "faction" currentItem = { name = value, info = "" } table.insert(factions, currentItem) i = i + 1 elseif prefix == "LINFO" and currentType == "faction" and currentItem then currentItem.info = value i = i + 1 elseif prefix == "FAC" then currentType = "faction" currentItem = { name = value, info = "" } table.insert(factions, currentItem) i = i + 1 else i = i + 1 end else i = i + 1 end end return { magics = magics, features = features, factions = factions } end -- 3. Generate HTML from parsed data local function generateHtmlFromData(dndData) local html = {} -- Container and header table.insert(html, "
") table.insert(html, "

D&D Information

") -- Tab navigation table.insert(html, "
") table.insert(html, " ") table.insert(html, " ") table.insert(html, " ") table.insert(html, " ") table.insert(html, " ") table.insert(html, " ") -- Magic tab content table.insert(html, "
") if #dndData.magics > 0 then table.insert(html, "
") for idx, magic in ipairs(dndData.magics) do local magicId = "magic-" .. idx local magicName = escapeHtml(magic.name) local magicInfo = escapeHtml(magic.info) table.insert(html, "
") table.insert(html, " ") table.insert(html, " ") table.insert(html, "

" .. magicInfo .. "

") table.insert(html, "
") end table.insert(html, "
") else table.insert(html, "
No magic available.
") end table.insert(html, "
") -- Features tab content table.insert(html, "
") if #dndData.features > 0 then table.insert(html, "
") for idx, feature in ipairs(dndData.features) do local featureId = "feature-" .. idx local featureName = escapeHtml(feature.name) local featureInfo = escapeHtml(feature.info) table.insert(html, "
") table.insert(html, " ") table.insert(html, " ") table.insert(html, "

" .. featureInfo .. "

") table.insert(html, "
") end table.insert(html, "
") else table.insert(html, "
No features available.
") end table.insert(html, "
") -- Factions tab content table.insert(html, "
") if #dndData.factions > 0 then table.insert(html, "
") for idx, faction in ipairs(dndData.factions) do local factionId = "faction-" .. idx local factionName = escapeHtml(faction.name) local factionInfo = escapeHtml(faction.info) table.insert(html, "
") table.insert(html, " ") table.insert(html, " ") table.insert(html, "

" .. factionInfo .. "

") table.insert(html, "
") end table.insert(html, "
") else table.insert(html, "
No faction information available.
") end table.insert(html, "
") table.insert(html, "
") -- .dnd-tabs table.insert(html, "
") -- .dnd-container -- CSS Styles table.insert(html, "") return table.concat(html, "\n") end ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -- Main Execution Logic ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- listenEdit("editDisplay", function(triggerId, data) if not data or data == "" then return "" end local output = "" local lastIndex = 1 -- 1. Extract DIC blocks local success, extractedBlocks = pcall(extractAllDicBlocks, data) if not success then print("[DND Parser] !!! extractAllDicBlocks Error:", extractedBlocks); return data end -- 2. Process extracted blocks and generate HTML if extractedBlocks and #extractedBlocks > 0 then for i, blockInfo in ipairs(extractedBlocks) do -- Add text before this block if blockInfo.rangeStart > lastIndex then output = output .. data:sub(lastIndex, blockInfo.rangeStart - 1) end -- Parse block content local parseSuccess, dndData = pcall(parseDicContent, blockInfo.content) if parseSuccess then -- Generate HTML local generateSuccess, blockHtml = pcall(generateHtmlFromData, dndData) if generateSuccess then output = output .. blockHtml -- Add generated HTML on success else -- HTML generation error print(string.format("[DND Parser] !!! generateHtmlFromData Error (Block %d): %s", i, blockHtml)) output = output .. "" end else -- Parsing error print(string.format("[DND Parser] !!! parseDicContent Error (Block %d): %s", i, dndData)) output = output .. "" end -- Update position for next iteration lastIndex = blockInfo.rangeEnd + 1 end else -- No blocks found lastIndex = 1 end -- 3. Add any remaining text after the last block if lastIndex <= #data then output = output .. data:sub(lastIndex) end return output end)

lorebook.key: ÏïÑÏù¥ÌÖú Í∞êÏ†ï, Í∞êÏ†ï, ÏïÑÏù¥ÌÖú Ï†ïÎ≥¥, Ï†ïÎ≥¥, Item information, Item appraisal
lorebook.content:
{{#if {{? {{getglobalvar::toggle_itemModule}}=1}}}}
## Item Information
-   The information of the D&D item MUST need to be written in XML format, without fenced code block: 

<itemData> 
	<name>{Name}</name> 
	<emoji>{Emoji}</emoji> 
	<type>{type}</type>
	 <rarity>{rarity}</rarity> 
	 <attunement>{attunement required}</attunement> 
	 <bonuses>{bonuses}</bonuses> 
	 <charges>{charges and recharge}</charges>
	  <appearance>{appearance}</appearance>
	   <lore>{Lore}</lore>
</itemData> 

- Rarity: 
	1. Divided into Common, Uncommon, Rare, Very Rare, Legendary, and Artifact. 
	2. Artifacts are the most powerful items in D&D. 
	3. Even a common item can sometimes be found in high-level dungeons.
	4. Rarity doesn't always correlate with usefulness - a common item might be perfect for specific situations. 
	5. The Rarity is the only part that should be in English
- Attunement and bonuses: 
	1. Specify if attunement is required (Yes/No). 
	2. Bonuses should be described in game mechanics terms. e.g. Bonuses - +2 to attack and damage rolls, advantage on Persuasion checks
 - Type: 
	 1. Divided into (weapon | armor | wondrous item | potion | scroll | wand | rod | ring | staff). 
- Charges and recharge: 
	1. If applicable, list number of charges and how they recharge. 
	2. Write "N/A" if the item doesn't use charges. e.g. 5 charges, regains 1d4+1 charges at dawn 
- Lore: 
	1. It consists of 1 to 3 sentences. 
	2. Write a brief history or legend about the item. 
	3. The story should convey emotion (mystery, grandeur, dread, wonder, etc). e.g. Forged in the dying breath of a silver dragon, this blade still carries echoes of its final roar. 
- Items not yet identified through Identify spell show all elements except emoji, appearance, and lore as "???". 
- Write in Korean. 
### Rules of Item Name 
- Item names typically consist of a descriptive element plus the item type. 
- The name of the item should reflect its rarity. 
- Common items have more mundane, practical names. 
- Higher rarity items have more evocative, powerful-sounding names. 
- Item names should match their appearance and function.
{{/if}}

{{#if_pure {{greater::{{chat_index}}::{{lastmessageid}}-1}}}}
(OOC: The following is the next part of the story plot provided by the user. Please rewrite the next part of the story based on this content.

## Excluding user inputs:
   - When writing answer, do not mention that have received the story from the user.
## Content to Continue:
   - Rewrite the sentence(s) or event(s) entered by the user.
## Maintain Consistency:
   - Maintain the existing settings (atmosphere, characters, events, etc.)
## New Development:
   - Advance the story by adding new events, dialogue, descriptions, etc., without simply summarizing or repeating the previous content.
## Avoid Repetition:
   - Do not repeat the sentences or paragraphs entered by the user verbatim.
## Enhance dialog:
   - Make the entered dialogs more intense and pervasive.

## Next stroy plot
Rewrite plot below:
$1
(Enrich the main character's dialogue and add reactions from surrounding characters.))

## Author's Memo
Before each the first paragraph of the roleplay response, create a planning memo using the following structure:
<memo>
Chapter # - Arc Title
Episode # - Episode Title
Genre, Tone, & Inspiration: Specify genre tags, overall mood, and sources of inspiration (e.g. anime, games, novels).
Writing Style Reference: Name an author or work to emulate for sentence structure and pacing, while developing a unique voice.
Overarching Goal & Key Moments: Define the story‚Äôs overarching plot, central theme, and the closing image or final message. Outline pivotal future scenes that serve as narrative goals. For the current chapter, preselect its most impactful scene and structure the chapter to build toward it. For each key scene, provide concrete sample dialogue and clear staging/blocking instructions, and keep this dialogue unchanged until the story reaches that scene, unless significant plot revisions require updates.
Story Structure: Outline chapters and episodes like a table of contents. Chapters must end at Episode 10. Episode titles should reflect their content.
Current Episode Objective: State the primary goal for the current episode. List key challenges or decision points for the characters to achieve it.
Queue: List potential events or branching points for the puture response and the characters actions that trigger them.
</memo>{{/if}}

## Author's Memo
Before writing the first paragraph of the roleplay, create a note in the following format:

<memo>
Chapter # - [Title of the major arc]
Episode # - [Title of the episode]

Context & Genre: Utilize relevant tropes, ideas, and examples from genre fiction and subculture (anime, manga, games, novels, light novels, visual novels). Establish the overall mood and tone by specifying relevant tags.
Reference Author: Analyze and emulate the sentence structure, pacing, and voice of selected works and authors as a reference. Apply this to the writing style while maintaining originality to develop a unique voice.
Long-term Goal: Establish a central theme or a major, overarching plot that runs through the entire story.
Milestones: Structure in a table-of-contents format. Create specific titles for chapters and episodes that allow for inferring the chapter's overall flow and theme, and the episode's general content. Plan to conclude a chapter at Episode 10 and prepare for the next. ‚ÄªImportant: A chapter must not exceed 10 episodes; do not proceed to Episode 11.
Short-term Goal: For each episode, define its main objective. Set several key branching points and immediate challenges required to achieve it (these can be flexible and change based on user input).
Queue: List potential future branching points and events that could follow the current response. Define the conditions that will trigger them.
</memo>{{/if}}

For the current chapter, preselect its most impactful scene and structure the chapter to build toward it. For each key scene, provide concrete sample dialogue and clear staging/blocking instructions, and keep this dialogue unchanged until the story reaches that scene, unless significant plot revisions require updates.
Story Structure: Outline chapters and episodes like a table of contents. Chapters must end at Episode 10. Episode titles should reflect their content.
Current Episode Objective: State the primary goal for the current episode. List key challenges or decision points for the characters to achieve it.
Queue: List potential events or branching points for the puture response and the characters actions that trigger them.
</memo>{{/if}}{{#if_pure {{? {{getglobalvar::toggle_SoT}}=2}}}}

{{#if {{? {{getglobalvar::toggle_ÎπÑÎ∞Ä}}}}}}
## Instructions for Handling Secret and Spoiler Information
Core principle
- Do not reveal secret or core plot information unless the user has directly discovered it through explicit in-story clues or actions.
- Never imply, confirm, or narrate hidden facts as known before they are earned in-story.
- This applies to the other characters as well, not just the user‚Äôs avatar ({{user}}).

When the user approaches secret information
1. Stay in character: Respond in ways consistent with the character‚Äôs personality, knowledge, and motives.
2. Avoid direct answers: Do not confirm or deny the secret. Do not state or validate hidden facts.
3. Use deflection techniques to steer away from the secret while keeping immersion:
   - Act flustered, evasive, or embarrassed.
   - Pretend not to know or misunderstand the question.
   - Naturally change the subject or shift focus to a safe topic.
   - Become defensive, suspicious, or protective.
   - Distract with immediate concerns, events, or sensory details in the scene.
   - Use any other method that fits the character‚Äôs established behavior.
4. Provide safe alternatives:
   - Offer non-revealing hints that encourage investigation without exposing the answer.
   - Pose guiding questions or present in-world obstacles that the user can explore.
   - Redirect to actionable goals that let the user discover clues organically.

Narrative conduct
- Do not output the secret directly, indirectly, or by implication. Avoid wording that presumes knowledge of the secret by the narrator or characters.
- If a scene risks exposing the secret, replace direct revelation with in-character avoidance, misdirection, or a narrative pivot that maintains continuity.
- Keep writing the scene‚Äîdo not stall, refuse, or break immersion; continue the roleplay while omitting the revealing content.
- Do not meta-signal that ‚Äúthere is a secret‚Äù or that information is being withheld; let the deflection arise naturally from character and context.{{/if}}

#### Twitter Interface Template

    - TWITTER[NAME:(Real Name)|TNAME:(Twitter Nickname)|TID:(Twitter ID)|TPROFILE:(Profile Image)|TWEET:(Tweet Content)|MEDIA:(Media)|HASH:(Hashtags)|TIME:(Posted Date/Time)|VIEW:(Viewer Count)|REPLY:(Reply Count)|RETWEET:(Retweet Count)|LIKES:(Likes Count)|COMMENT:(Viewer Nickname1)|(Comment Body1)|(Viewer Nickname2)|(Comment Body2)|...]
    - NAME: Real name of the Twitter account's owner(e.g., 'Eun-Young').
    - TNAME: The nickname of the character on Twitter.
    - TID: The unique identifier for the character on Twitter, no @ sign.
        - If character ALREADY has a Twitter ID, use the EXISTING ONE.
        - Else, MAKE UP a new one.
            - Example: If TWITTER[NAME:Iono|TNAME:‚ö°Moyamo‚ö°|TID:Moyamo_PaldeaQueen|...] exists.

                - Valid: TWITTER[NAME:Iono|TNAME:‚ö°Moyamo‚ö°|TID:Moyamo_PaldeaQueen|...]
    - TPROFILE: The profile image of the character on Twitter.
{{#if {{equal::{{getglobalvar::toggle_SNS-Forme.NoImage}}::0}}}}
        - Print '<SNS>' Exactly.
    - TWEET: Content of the Tweet.
        - MUST INLUDE the character's NSFW POST.

            - Invalid: Hello! I'm Akari #Akari

{{/if}}

{{#if {{equal::{{getglobalvar::toggle_SNS-Forme.Target}}::0}}}}
        - Print {{source::user}} Exactly.
    - TWEET: Content of the Tweet.
        - MUST INCLUDE the {{user}}'s NSFW POST.
        - NO #HASHTAGS ALLOWED AT HERE.
            - Invalid: Hello! I'm Akari #Akari
            - Valid: Hello! I'm Akari

{{/if}}

    - TWEET: Content of the Tweet.

            - Invalid: Hello! I'm Akari #Akari
            - Valid: Hello! I'm Akari
    - MEDIA: Media of the post
        - Describe the situation of the twitter post.
{{/if}}
{{/if}}
    - HASH: The hashtags of the tweet.
        - # Tag.
        - If post includes NSFW content, first tag is 'ÏÑπÌä∏'.
            - #ÏÑπÌä∏
        - Final value example: #ÏÑπÌä∏ #BitchDog #PublicToilet
    - TIME: The date and time the tweet was posted.
        - Format: AM/PM hh:mm¬∑YYYY. MM. DD (e.g., PM 12:58¬∑2026. 03. 29)
    - VIEW: The number of viewers of the tweet.
    - REPLY: The number of replies to the tweet.
    - RETWEET: The number of retweets of the tweet.
    - LIKES: The number of likes on the tweet.
    - COMMENT:
        - Viewer Nickname: The nickname of the viewer who replied to the tweet.
            - Use the realistic Twitter nickname.
            - Final value example:
                - Invalid: KinkyDog
                - Valid: ÏÑπÌä∏ÌóåÌÑ∞

                        "|RETWEET:" .. (twRetweet or "") .. 
                        "|LIKES:" .. (twLikes or "") .. 
                        "|COMMENT:" .. (twCommentBlock or "") .. "]"

                    currentLine = string.sub(currentLine, 1, s_twitter-1) .. replacementTwitter .. string.sub(currentLine, e_twitter + 1)
                    lineModifiedInThisPass = true
                elseif profileInlayToUse then
                    local replacementTwitter = "TWITTER[NAME:" .. (twName or "") .. 
                        "|TNAME:" .. (twTname or "") .. 
                        "|TID:" .. (twTid or "") .. 
                        "|TPROFILE:" .. profileInlayToUse ..
                        "|TWEET:" .. (twTweet or "") .. 
                        "|MEDIA:" .. (twMedia or "") .. 
                        "|HASH:" .. (twHash or "") .. 
                        "|TIME:" .. (twTime or "") .. 
                        "|VIEW:" .. (twView or "") .. 
                        "|REPLY:" .. (twReply or "") .. 
                        "|RETWEET:" .. (twRetweet or "") .. 
                        "|LIKES:" .. (twLikes or "") .. 
                        "|COMMENT:" .. (twCommentBlock or "") .. "]"
                    currentLine = string.sub(currentLine, 1, s_twitter-1) .. replacementTwitter .. string.sub(currentLine, e_twitter + 1)
                    lineModifiedInThisPass = true
                end
            elseif profileInlayToUse then
                local replacementTwitter = "TWITTER[NAME:" .. (twName or "") .. 
                    "|TNAME:" .. (twTname or "") .. 
                    "|TID:" .. (twTid or "") .. 
                    "|TPROFILE:" .. profileInlayToUse ..
                    "|TWEET:" .. (twTweet or "") .. 
                    "|MEDIA:" .. (twMedia or "") .. 
                    "|HASH:" .. (twHash or "") .. 
                    "|TIME:" .. (twTime or "") .. 
                    "|VIEW:" .. (twView or "") .. 
                    "|REPLY:" .. (twReply or "") .. 
                    "|RETWEET:" .. (twRetweet or "") .. 
                    "|LIKES:" .. (twLikes or "") .. 
                    "|COMMENT:" .. (twCommentBlock or "") .. "]"
                currentLine = string.sub(currentLine, 1, s_twitter-1) .. replacementTwitter .. string.sub(currentLine, e_twitter + 1)
                lineModifiedInThisPass = true
            end
        end
    end
    
    -- Instagram Ï≤òÎ¶¨
    if SNSMode == "2" or SNSMode == "3" then
        -- Instagram Ìå®ÌÑ¥ ÌôïÏù∏ Î∞è Ï≤òÎ¶¨
        local instaPromptFindPattern = "%[SNSINSTAPROMPT:([^%]]*)%]"
        local instaPattern = "(INSTA)%[NAME:([^|]*)|IID:([^|]*)|IPROFILE:([^|]*)|POST:([^|]*)|MEDIA:([^|]*)|HASH:([^|]*)|TIME:([^|]*)|LIKES:([^|]*)|REPLY:([^|]*)|SHARE:([^%]]*)%]"
        
        local s_insta, e_insta, instaCap1, instaName, instaIid, instaIprofile, instaPost, instaMedia, instaHash, instaTime, instaLikes, instaReply, instaShare = string.find(currentLine, instaPattern)
        
        if s_insta then
            print("Found Instagram block")
            instagramId = instaIid -- Ïù∏Ïä§ÌÉÄÍ∑∏Îû® ID Ï†ÄÏû•
            local profileInlayToUse = nil

            if instagramId then
                local existingProfileInlay = getState(triggerId, instagramId) or "null"
                
                if existingProfileInlay == "null" or not existingProfileInlay then
                    local profilePromptFindPattern = "%[SNSINSTAPROFILEPROMPT:([^%]]*)%]"
                    
                    local _, _, foundProfilePrompt = string.find(currentLine, profilePromptFindPattern)
                    
                    if foundProfilePrompt then
                        print("Generating Instagram profile image")
                        local finalPromptInstaProfile = (artistPrompt or "") .. ", " .. (qualityPrompt or "") .. ", " .. (foundProfilePrompt or "")

                        local inlayProfile = generateImage(triggerId, finalPromptInstaProfile, negativePrompt):await()
                        
                        if inlayProfile and type(inlayProfile) == "string" and 
                            string.len(inlayProfile) > 10 and 
                            not string.find(inlayProfile, "fail", 1, true) and 
                            not string.find(inlayProfile, "error", 1, true) and 
                            not string.find(inlayProfile, "Ïã§Ìå®", 1, true) then
                            profileInlayToUse = inlayProfile
                            setState(triggerId, instagramId, profileInlayToUse)
                        else
                            print("Instagram profile image generation failed")
                        end
                    end
                else
                    profileInlayToUse = existingProfileInlay
                end
            end

            local _, _, foundInstaPrompt = string.find(currentLine, instaPromptFindPattern)
            
            if foundInstaPrompt then
                local finalPromptInstaPost = (artistPrompt or "") .. ", " .. (qualityPrompt or "") .. ", " .. foundInstaPrompt
                print("Generating Instagram content image")
                local inlayInsta = generateImage(triggerId, finalPromptInstaPost, negativePrompt):await()
                
                if inlayInsta and type(inlayInsta) == "string" and 
                    string.len(inlayInsta) > 10 and 
                    not string.find(inlayInsta, "fail", 1, true) and 
                    not string.find(inlayInsta, "error", 1, true) and 
                    not string.find(inlayInsta, "Ïã§Ìå®", 1, true) then
                    
                    local replacementInsta = "INSTA[NAME:" .. (instaName or "") .. 
                        "|IID:" .. (instaIid or "") .. 
                        "|IPROFILE:" .. (profileInlayToUse or instaIprofile or "") .. 
                        "|POST:" .. (instaPost or "") .. 
                        "|MEDIA:" .. inlayInsta ..
                        "|HASH:" .. (instaHash or "") .. 
                        "|TIME:" .. (instaTime or "") .. 
                        "|LIKES:" .. (instaLikes or "") .. 
                        "|REPLY:" .. (instaReply or "") .. 
                        "|SHARE:" .. (instaShare or "") .. "]"

                    currentLine = string.sub(currentLine, 1, s_insta-1) .. replacementInsta .. string.sub(currentLine, e_insta + 1)
                    lineModifiedInThisPass = true
                elseif profileInlayToUse then
                    local replacementInsta = "INSTA[NAME:" .. (instaName or "") .. 
                        "|IID:" .. (instaIid or "") .. 
                        "|IPROFILE:" .. profileInlayToUse ..
                        "|POST:" .. (instaPost or "") .. 
                        "|MEDIA:" .. (instaMedia or "") .. 
                        "|HASH:" .. (instaHash or "") .. 
                        "|TIME:" .. (instaTime or "") .. 
                        "|LIKES:" .. (instaLikes or "") .. 
                        "|REPLY:" .. (instaReply or "") .. 
                        "|SHARE:" .. (instaShare or "") .. "]"
                    currentLine = string.sub(currentLine, 1, s_insta-1) .. replacementInsta .. string.sub(currentLine, e_insta + 1)
                    lineModifiedInThisPass = true
                end
            elseif profileInlayToUse then
                local replacementInsta = "INSTA[NAME:" .. (instaName or "") .. 
                    "|IID:" .. (instaIid or "") .. 
                    "|IPROFILE:" .. profileInlayToUse ..
                    "|POST:" .. (instaPost or "") .. 
                    "|MEDIA:" .. (instaMedia or "") .. 
                    "|HASH:" .. (instaHash or "") .. 
                    "|TIME:" .. (instaTime or "") .. 
                    "|LIKES:" .. (instaLikes or "") .. 
                    "|REPLY:" .. (instaReply or "") .. 
                    "|SHARE:" .. (instaShare or "") .. "]"
                currentLine = string.sub(currentLine, 1, s_insta-1) .. replacementInsta .. string.sub(currentLine, e_insta + 1)
                lineModifiedInThisPass = true
            end
        end
    end
        
    finalText = currentLine
    
    return finalText
end

return onOutput

local function escapeHtml(str) if not str then return "" end str = string.gsub(str, "&", "&") str = string.gsub(str, "<", "<") str = string.gsub(str, ">", ">") str = string.gsub(str, "\"", """) str = string.gsub(str, "'", "'") str = string.gsub(str, "{", "{") str = string.gsub(str, "}", "}") return str end local function eraseDisplay(triggerId, data) data = string.gsub(data, "TWITTER%[([^%]]*)%]",
